heuristics.name: Visibility of System Status
heuristics.description: The design should always keep users informed about what is going on, through appropriate feedback within a reasonable amount of time.

checks.name: Loading indicator presence
checks.description: Actions that take time should show loading indicators

checks.name: Active navigation state
checks.description: Current page/section should be visually indicated in navigation

checks.name: Multi-step progress indicator
checks.description: Multi-step processes should show current step and total steps

heuristics.name: Match Between System and Real World
heuristics.description: The design should speak the users' language. Use words, phrases, and concepts familiar to the user, rather than internal jargon.

checks.name: Clear button labels
checks.description: Button text should clearly describe the action

heuristics.name: User Control and Freedom
heuristics.description: Users often perform actions by mistake. They need a clearly marked 'emergency exit' to leave the unwanted action without having to go through an extended process.

checks.name: Cancel/back button in forms
checks.description: Forms and dialogs should have cancel or back options

checks.name: Undo capability
checks.description: Destructive actions should be undoable when possible

checks.name: Modal close option
checks.description: Modal dialogs should have clear close/dismiss options

heuristics.name: Consistency and Standards
heuristics.description: Users should not have to wonder whether different words, situations, or actions mean the same thing. Follow platform and industry conventions.

checks.name: Consistent action placement
checks.description: Primary actions should be consistently placed across screens

heuristics.name: Error Prevention
heuristics.description: Good error messages are important, but the best designs carefully prevent problems from occurring in the first place.

checks.name: Destructive action confirmation
checks.description: Delete and other destructive actions should require confirmation

checks.name: Input validation presence
checks.description: Forms should have validation to prevent invalid submissions

checks.name: Input constraints
checks.description: Inputs should have appropriate constraints (type, pattern, required)

heuristics.name: Recognition Rather Than Recall
heuristics.description: Minimize the user's memory load by making elements, actions, and options visible. The user should not have to remember information from one part of the interface to another.

checks.name: Visible form labels
checks.description: Form fields should have visible labels (not just placeholders)

checks.name: Persistent navigation
checks.description: Navigation should remain visible/accessible across the app

checks.name: Contextual hints
checks.description: Complex inputs should have helper text explaining expected format

heuristics.name: Flexibility and Efficiency of Use
heuristics.description: Shortcuts — hidden from novice users — can speed up the interaction for the expert user such that the design can cater to both inexperienced and experienced users.

checks.name: Search for large lists
checks.description: Lists with many items should have search/filter capability

checks.name: Keyboard shortcuts
checks.description: Common actions should support keyboard shortcuts

heuristics.name: Aesthetic and Minimalist Design
heuristics.description: Interfaces should not contain information which is irrelevant or rarely needed. Every extra unit of information in an interface competes with the relevant units of information.

checks.name: Proper heading hierarchy
checks.description: Content should have clear heading hierarchy (H1 > H2 > H3)

checks.name: Single H1 per page
checks.description: Each page should have exactly one H1 heading

checks.name: Content density
checks.description: Content should be appropriately spaced and not overcrowded

heuristics.name: Help Users Recognize, Diagnose, and Recover from Errors
heuristics.description: Error messages should be expressed in plain language (no error codes), precisely indicate the problem, and constructively suggest a solution.

checks.name: Inline error messages
checks.description: Form errors should appear inline near the problematic field

checks.name: Clear error messaging
checks.description: Error messages should explain what went wrong and how to fix it

heuristics.name: Help and Documentation
heuristics.description: It's best if the system doesn't need any additional explanation. However, it may be necessary to provide documentation to help users understand how to complete their tasks.

checks.name: Help availability
checks.description: Complex interfaces should have accessible help or documentation

checks.name: Tooltips for icons
checks.description: Icon-only buttons should have tooltips explaining their function
